com.ibm.team.repository.common

Interface IContent


  • public interface IContent
    Represents a description of content that is stored in the repository. The actual contents (e.g. the bytes) are stored and retrieved using an IContentManager and this description as the identity of the bytes.
    Since:
    0.5

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String CONTENT_TYPE_TEXT
      Common Content type constant (value "text/plain") for text/plain.
      static java.lang.String CONTENT_TYPE_UNKNOWN
      Common Content type constant (value "application/unknown") for arbitrary binary content.
      static java.lang.String CONTENT_TYPE_XML
      Common Content type constant (value "application/xml") for application/xml.
      static java.lang.String ENCODING_US_ASCII
      Common Character encoding constants.
      static java.lang.String ENCODING_UTF_16BE

      static java.lang.String ENCODING_UTF_8

    • Method Detail

      • getContentId

        UUID getContentId()
        Returns the unique id of this content. The content id gives contents their identity.
        Returns:
        the content id; never null

      • getContentType

        java.lang.String getContentType()
        Returns the content type identifier that describes the nature of the content. The identifier format follows the Internet Media Types specification for media types (e.g. text/plain, application/unknown) as defined in s RFC 2046.

        The encoding will be specified separately by getCharacterEncoding();

        Returns:
        the content type identifier that describes the nature of the content; never null

      • getCharacterEncoding

        java.lang.String getCharacterEncoding()
        Returns the character encoding for the content. This is an IANA character set encoding name such as "8859_1", "us-ascii", "iso-8859-1", "UTF8", or "shift_jis". The official registry of "charset" (i.e., character encoding) names, with references to documents defining their meanings, is kept by IANA at http://www.iana.org/assignments/character-sets.
        Returns:
        the character encoding for this content or null if unknown or not applicable to this content type.

      • getRawLength

        long getRawLength()
        Returns the length of the content referenced by this content handle. This length is the raw size of the content. The content lineDelimiters have been converted according to getLineDelimiter() For content with IContent#LINE_DELIMITER_PLATFORM, the line delimiter used during transmission is IContent#LINE_DELIMITER_LF.
        Returns:
        the length of the content references by this content handle after converting the line delimiters (as required).

      • getRawHashCode

        com.ibm.team.repository.common.utils.HashCode getRawHashCode()
        Returns the checksum value for the content. This is a simple measure to allow data integrity checks on the contents. This is a checksum value for contents after any line delimiter translations that may have taken place prior to transmission. This may not be the checksum of the original contents requested to be stored if the line delimiters were converted. This may not be the checksum of the contents retrieved from IContentManager if line delimiters are translated.
        Returns:
        the checksum value. May be null if not known

      • getEstimatedConvertedLength

        long getEstimatedConvertedLength()
        Returns the length of the content referenced by this content handle after any conversion required by getLineDelimiter() In most cases this length will be the same as the #getTransimissionContentLength() In the case of content with IContent#LINE_DELIMITER_PLATFORM line delimiters, the length may be different if the platform uses "CRLF" as the line delimiter. In this case, the length may be longer than the transmission length depending on the number of lines in the content.
        Returns:
        the estimated length of the content referenced by this content handle after conversion for agreement with the getLineDelimiter(). If this content's encoding is not known to the current platform, then this just an estimation.

      • getLineDelimiter

        LineDelimiter getLineDelimiter()
        The preferred line delimiter to be used when the content is retrieved. Valid values include #LINE_DELIMITER_PLATFORM #LINE_DELIMITER_NONE, #LINE_DELIMITER_LF, #LINE_DELIMITER_CRLF, #LINE_DELIMITER_CR
        Returns:
        the line delimiter for the content. The default is #LINE_DELIMITER_NONE
